Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)
Thank you for submitting this review.
This would be helpful for others to know the design and implementation easier instead of going through code.

More details please: 
What is the proposed configuration? How does the detection work?
Will removal of device is detected also?
What are the interfaces will be created?

Details are added in the document. 
Removal of device is currently not supported in IPMB FRU.
Is this IPMB bus number or channel?
Does each config mean each IPMBDevice? Can multiple IPMBDevices exist on same IPMB bus with different addresses?

> Does each config mean each IPMBDevice?

Yes, each config represent each IPMBDevice.



> Can multiple IPMBDevices exist on same IPMB bus with different addresses?

Yes, same IPMB bus can have different addresses, but in our platform, we don't have multiple IPMB devices exist on same bus.
This is IPMB bus number.
How will these sensor get updated, one at a time with reservation ID? Is it only the sensor value being polled. Will they support update in threshold value?

Foe each interface (xyz.openbmc_project.Configuration.IpmbDevice) detected for IPMB device, all the sensors related to that IPMB device will be accessed from the map which are stored. Each sensor's name, device address, threshold values and unit are updated and displayed one at a time by invoking IpmbSensor constructor under IpmbSensor service.

Added a new IpmbType for SDR sensor to frame the data packet for each sensor based on the sensor's unique number received. Sensor value will be read based on the pollng rate and it will be updated in dbus property.
All the comments have been marked resolved.  Is there a plan to upload a new patchset to allow review of the updated design?
Uploaded a second patchset after addressing the comments.

This is a bit misleading, because OpenBMC does support IPMI SDR commands.
Maybe just remove the sentence.
+1.  phosphor-host-ipmi definitely has 2 different implementations of SDRs.  I think what you're getting at is that we don't yet have an SDR parser that can read in an SDR and add resources to dbus.
Done

Nit, please reword a little.  It doesn't support "SDR" it supports controllers without an SDR, (like management engine) with the bmc having prior knowledge of sensor numbers without an SDR.

Mostly just take the word "SDR" out of this sentence.
Done
detecting IPMB FRU and getting SDR through IPMB commands
Done

entity-manager is an implementation detail.  the requirement is:
Developer must be able to declare a supported SDR capable device.
Done
More details needed here.  What "sensor information" just values?  Thresholds?  Status?  I suspect all is needed here.
Done
No user-facing requirements?  Does this need to show up in redfish?  IPMI?

sensors will show up in redfish, since for each host, FRU will be generated and it will show up under below paths
/redfish/v1/Chassis/Twinlake_Board/Power, 
/redfish/v1/Chassis/Twinlake_Board/Sensors, 
/redfish/v1/Chassis/Twinlake_Board/Thermal.
Done

The way this diagram is drawn, it looks like there's one SDR repository for multiple IPMB devices, which isn't going to work.  Each IPMB device needs its own SDR repository, so that when it's removed, we can remove JUST that devices SDR info.

So long as that's understood, I'm not worried about if the diagram is updated, but one global SDR store for all sdr capable devices isn't going to work.

Done

Updated the diagram and each SDR config will have its own object created.
?  It's not clear what "Class" helps with here.  If this parameter were modified, what different code paths would be executed?

The below mentioned data in the gerrit patch will be changed, if there is any change in the "class". For this change, "Class" is used here.

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/38905/57/src/IpmbSensor.cpp#160
Need a poll rate added?  I don't think the poll rate is available via the SDR.
PollRate is not added in the config file. In the code, default value as 1 second is used as pollRate for all sensor in SDR.

Considering that we're already talking to the IPMB device from dbus-sensors, should the IPMBdaemon there just be responsible for enumerating FRU devices from IPMBdevice?  Both will need to read the SDR regardless, otherwise we have to duplicate data.

IPMB FRU is separate service (xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmb.FruDevice.service) which will be running already to detect the FRU details of each IPMB devices using i2c EEPROM and displayed in dbus path.

For this implementation, a gerrit patch is submitted.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39593
Done

How this works isn't super clear to me.  If you have a probe using, Ipmb.FruDevice, how does IPMB.FruDevice populate it's information?  Does it just assume that all IPMB channels have a valid fru on the other side?

IPMB FRU is separate service (xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmb.FruDevice.service) which will be running already to detect the FRU details of each IPMB devices using i2c EEPROM and displayed in dbus path.

For this implementation, a gerrit patch is submitted.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39593
Done
The naming of this would be something like "TwinLake board" or "Compute node"  IPMB isn't the name of the inventory item.
Done

lets leave this as an implementation detail.  Generally in dbus-senors we don't store global maps like this (see coding standard about non-const globals), we keep each individual class independent so it can be destroyed later without consequences when the config changes.  Keeping global objects like this ties together implementations to a singleton, which means that if one IPMB agent locks up, it's more likely that it locks up the rest.

Regarding this map, I have provided the deatils in the implementation patch for the clarification. Please provide your suggestions on that patch.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/dbus-sensors/+/52160/34/include/IpmbSDRSensor.hpp
nit, looks like some line wrapping issues.
Done
Generally not how this is done in dbus-sensors, and because each sensor might have a different polling time, we tend to add them each to their own loop, so we can parallelized as much as possible.

Done.

This is to create the dbus paths and interfaces, which will be done in createSensors function.
Can you please clarify this sentence?  what is an IpmbType?  what does "frame the data packet" mean?  Where are we receiving the sensor ID from?  Is the sensor ID the sensor number?

> what is an IpmbType?

It is based on the entity config "Class" to define the which commands needs to be used for SDR to get the sensor value using IPMB.


> what does "frame the data packet" mean?  

IPMB sendRequest commands to get the sensor value.


> Where are we receiving the sensor ID from?  

sensor Number will be received from the SDR information for each sensor.


> Is the sensor ID the sensor number?

Yes, it is the sensor number.
This is the first mention of polling rate in this document;  Please call out how you expect that to work.  Is it user settable?
For now, polling rate is set as default value (1 second) for all sensor. Since, IPMI spec does not have polling time mentioned for each sensor.
Done

I read this as "This doesn't have any impacts except the things it impacts" which isn't the point of this section.

Please go through the template and try to answer the questions.
Done

Not nearly enough detail.  will there be:
robot tests?
Stress tests?
performance tests?
unit tests?
Done
What dynamic support is being described in this design doc?  This sentence isn't clear.
Ack
Done

This proposal seems to be how to dynamically add a SDR and doesn't cover removal of a SDR (which is a use case for a multi-slot system with a single BMC controlling all server slots).  There is also a gap in how sensors names would be determined as this has a real impact on the data center tooling monitoring the sensors by name.
Ack

Removal of SDR is based on IPMB FRU. The design is discussed in the below link. After completing this, sensor can also be removed based on IPMB FRU removal.
https://github.com/facebookexternal/openbmc.hcl/issues/69

Sensor names are received from Get SDR commands using IPMB, therefore, it is not assigned statically.
'Data records contain information...'
Ack
Done

How will dynamic removal be handled?

As an example, on a multi-slot system with a single BMC, a slot may be removed, which will require the corresponding SDR records to be removed as well.  How will this be handled in the configuration file?

Also, how will expansion cards which are connected to a slot and detected after the BMC is up and operational be handled dynamically?  Assuming the expansion card is hot-swappable, it may require some SDR records corresponding to the slot be kept while expansion board specific SDR records are removed.

https://github.com/facebookexternal/openbmc.hcl/issues/69

SDR sensor is populated based on Host FRU. The proposal for removing host is discussed in the above link. Once the implementation is done, SDR sensor can make use of it by detecting the number of host FRU generated.
Done

How will the sensor name be dynamically obtained?  Sensors names are fixed for a platform even if the SDRs themselves come and go.  For instance, a sensor named SLOT1_INLET_TEMP will always be named that even if slot 1 is removed and then re-inserted.  Names cannot be dynamically assigned as this would prevent data center tooling from finding and using them.
Ack

"Name": "$bus + 1 Twinlake Board",

This name represents the number of IPMB Device in entity-manager. For each device, all the sensor names will be read from Get SDR commands and displayed in dbus path.
Can you resolve Ed's comments so we can move forward with this proposal?
Sure

Hi Ed / Zhikui Ren,

Could you please provide your suggestions / approval for this patch.

Thanks

Hi Ed / Zhikui Ren,

Could you please provide your suggestions / approval for this patch.

Thanks
typo?
